DCL Public API: File System

Send comments on this topic.

Summary

DclFsBecomeFileUser   Allow this thread to access the file system.
DclFsDirClose   Close an open directory.
DclFsDirCreate   Create a directory.
DclFsDirGetWorking   Retrieve the current working directory.
DclFsDirOpen   Open a directory for reading.
DclFsDirRead   Read the next entry in a directory.
DclFsDirRemove   Remove a directory.
DclFsDirRename   Rename or move a directory.
DclFsDirRewind   Reset the position within an open directory.
DclFsDirSetWorking   Set the current working directory.
DclFsDirTreeDelete   Remove the specified directory tree.
DclFsDirTreeEnumerate   Enumerate everything in the specified directory tree.
DclFsFileClose   Close an open file.
DclFsFileDelete   Delete a file.
DclFsFileFlush   Flushes any pending file data.
DclFsFileOpen   Open a file.
DclFsFileRead   Read data from a file.
DclFsFileRename   Rename or move a file.
DclFsFileSeek   Seek to a position in a file.
DclFsFileTell   Obtain the current position in a file.
DclFsFileWrite   Write data to a file.
DclFsReleaseFileUser   Indicate that this thread is finished accessing the file system.
DclFsStat   Retrieve information about a file or directory.
DclFsStatFs   Retrieve information about a file system.

DclFsBecomeFileUser

DCLSTATUS DclFsBecomeFileUser(void)
Allow this thread to access the file system.

Parameters

None.

Return Value

Returns a DCLSTATUS value indicating the operation result.

DclFsDirClose

DCLSTATUS DclFsDirClose( DCLFSDIRHANDLE hDir)
Close an open directory.

Parameters

hDir - The handle returned by an earlier call to DclOsFsDirOpen().

Return Value

Returns a DCLSTATUS value representing a class of errors defined in dlstatus.h.

DclFsDirCreate

DCLSTATUS DclFsDirCreate( const char * pszPath)
Create a directory.

Parameters

pszPath - The path to the directory to create.

Return Value

Returns a DCLSTATUS value representing a class of errors defined in dlstatus.h.

See Also

DclFsDirRemove

DclFsDirGetWorking

DCLSTATUS DclFsDirGetWorking(
    char * pszPath,
    unsigned nMaxPathLength)
Retrieve the current working directory.

Parameters

pszPath - A buffer to receive the current working directory.
uMaxPathLength - Size of buffer including the NULL terminator.

Return Value

Returns a DCLSTATUS value representing a class of errors defined in dlstatus.h.

NOTE

If this functionality is not supported, this function may return an error code (without asserting), and things like the shell will take note of that and avoid using either of the "Get/SetCWD" functions.

See Also

DclFsDirSetWorking

DclFsDirOpen

DCLSTATUS DclFsDirOpen(
    const char * pszPath,
    DCLFSDIRHANDLE * phDir)
Open a directory for reading.

Parameters

pszPath - The path to the directory.
phDir - Populated with a DCLFSDIRHANDLE used to access the directory.

Return Value

Returns a DCLSTATUS value representing a class of errors defined in dlstatus.h.

See Also

DclFsDirRead DclFsDirRewind DclFsDirClose

DclFsDirRead

DCLSTATUS DclFsDirRead(
    DCLFSDIRHANDLE hDir,
    char * pszName,
    unsigned nMaxNameLength,
    DCLFSSTAT * pStat)
Read the next entry in a directory.

Parameters

hDir - The handle returned by an earlier call to DclFsDirOpen.
pszName - Populated with the next name in the directory.
uMaxNameLength - Size of pszName including the NULL terminator.
pStat - Populated with information about the entry. This can be NULL if the information is not desired.

Return Value

Returns a DCLSTATUS value representing a class of errors defined in dlstatus.h.

DclFsDirRemove

DCLSTATUS DclFsDirRemove( const char * pszPath)
Remove a directory.

Parameters

pszPath - The path to the directory to remove.

Return Value

Returns a DCLSTATUS value representing a class of errors defined in dlstatus.h.

See Also

DclFsDirCreate

DclFsDirRename

DCLSTATUS DclFsDirRename(
    const char * pszOrigPath,
    const char * pszNewPath)
Rename or move a directory.

Parameters

pszOrigPath - The old path.
pszNewPath - The new path.

Return Value

Returns a DCLSTATUS value representing a class of errors defined in dlstatus.h.

DclFsDirRewind

DCLSTATUS DclFsDirRewind( DCLFSDIRHANDLE hDir)
Reset the position within an open directory.

Parameters

hDir - The handle returned by an earlier call to DclFsDirOpen.

Return Value

Returns a DCLSTATUS value representing a class of errors defined in dlstatus.h.

DclFsDirSetWorking

DCLSTATUS DclFsDirSetWorking( const char * pszPath)
Set the current working directory.

Parameters

pszPath - The path of the directory to set as the CWD.

Return Value

Returns a DCLSTATUS value representing a class of errors defined in dlstatus.h.

See Also

DclFsDirGetWorking

DclFsDirTreeDelete

DCLSTATUS DclFsDirTreeDelete(
    const char *pszDirSpec,
    unsigned nVerbosity,
    D_BOOL fHiddenSystem,
    D_BOOL fDeleteReadonly,
    D_BOOL fIgnoreErrors)
Remove the specified directory tree.

Note -- The fDeleteReadonly flag is not yet supported. It may be used, but it is not functional.

Note -- There is no special handling of the current working directory. Attempting to remove it will result in undefined behavior.

Parameters

pszDirSpec - A pointer to the null-terminated directory name to remove.
nVerbosity - The standard DCL verbosity level to use.
fHiddenSystem - TRUE to process files and directories which have either of the hidden or system attributes set.
fDeleteReadonly - TRUE to forcibly delete readonly files and directories.
fIgnoreErrors - TRUE if errors should be ignored rather than causing the operation to abort.

Return Value

Returns a DCLSTATUS value indicating the results.

DclFsDirTreeEnumerate

DCLSTATUS DclFsDirTreeEnumerate(
    const char *pszDirSpec,
    DCLFSDIRENUMCALLBACK *pfnCallback,
    void *pCallbackContext,
    D_BOOL fHiddenSystem)
Enumerate everything in the specified directory tree.

Parameters

pszDirSpec - A pointer to the null-terminated directory name to enumerate.
pfnCallback - The callback function to use.
pCallbackContext - A context pointer to pass to the callback function.
fHiddenSystem - TRUE to process files and directories which have either of the hidden or system attributes set.

Return Value

Returns a DCLSTATUS value indicating the results.

DclFsFileClose

DCLSTATUS DclFsFileClose( DCLFSFILEHANDLE hFile)
Close an open file.

Parameters

hFile - The handle returned by an earlier call to DclFsFileOpen.

Return Value

Returns a DCLSTATUS value indicating the result.

DclFsFileDelete

DCLSTATUS DclFsFileDelete( const char *pszPath)
Delete a file.

Parameters

pszPath - The path of the file to delete.

Return Value

Returns a DCLSTATUS value indicating the operation result.

DclFsFileFlush

DCLSTATUS DclFsFileFlush( DCLFSFILEHANDLE hFile)
Flushes any pending file data.

Parameters

hFile - The handle returned by an earlier call to DclFsFileOpen.

Return Value

Returns a DCLSTATUS value indicating the result.

DclFsFileOpen

DCLSTATUS DclFsFileOpen(
    const char *pszPath,
    const char *pszMode,
    DCLFSFILEHANDLE *phFile)
Open a file. This API can also be used to create or truncate files.

Parameters

pszPath - The path to the file.
pszMode - The file open mode.
phFile - Populated with a DCLFSFILEHANDLE used to access the file.

Return Value

Returns a DCLSTATUS value indicating the result.

DclFsFileRead

DCLSTATUS DclFsFileRead(
    DCLFSFILEHANDLE hFile,
    void *pBuffer,
    D_UINT32 ulSize,
    D_UINT32 *pulTransfered)
Read data from a file.

Parameters

hFile - The handle returned by an earlier call to DclFsFileOpen.
pBuffer - A pointer to the buffer to fill.
ulSize - Number of bytes to read.
pulTransfered - Populated with the number of bytes actually read.

Return Value

Returns a DCLSTATUS value indicating the result.

DclFsFileRename

DCLSTATUS DclFsFileRename(
    const char *pszOrigPath,
    const char *pszNewPath)
Rename or move a file.

Parameters

pszOrigPath - The old path.
pszNewPath - The new path.

Return Value

Returns a DCLSTATUS value indicating the operation result.

DclFsFileSeek

DCLSTATUS DclFsFileSeek(
    DCLFSFILEHANDLE hFile,
    D_INT32 lOffset,
    int iOrigin)
Seek to a position in a file.

Parameters

hFile - The handle returned by an earlier call to DclFsFileOpen.
lOffset - Relative file position.
iOrgin - Relative to what location in a file. DCLFSFILESEEK_SET, DCLFSFILESEEK_CUR, or DCLFSFILESEEK_END.

Return Value

Returns a DCLSTATUS value indicating the result.

DclFsFileTell

DCLSTATUS DclFsFileTell(
    DCLFSFILEHANDLE hFile,
    D_UINT32 *pulPosition)
Obtain the current position in a file.

Parameters

hFile - The handle returned by an earlier call to DclFsFileOpen.
pulPosition - Populated with the current file position.

Return Value

Returns a DCLSTATUS value indicating the result.

DclFsFileWrite

DCLSTATUS DclFsFileWrite(
    DCLFSFILEHANDLE hFile,
    const void *pBuffer,
    D_UINT32 ulSize,
    D_UINT32 *pulTransfered)
Write data to a file.

Parameters

hFile - The handle returned by an earlier call to DclFsFileOpen.
pBuffer - A pointer to the buffer from which to write.
ulSize - Number of bytes to write.
pulTransfered - Populated with the number of bytes actually written.

Return Value

Returns a DCLSTATUS value indicating the result.

DclFsReleaseFileUser

DCLSTATUS DclFsReleaseFileUser(void)
Indicate that this thread is finished accessing the file system.

Parameters

None.

Return Value

Returns a DCLSTATUS value indicating the operation result.

DclFsStat

DCLSTATUS DclFsStat(
    const char *pszPath,
    DCLFSSTAT *pStat)
Retrieve information about a file or directory.

Parameters

pszPath - The path of the object to get info about.
pStat - A buffer to receive the Stat information.

Return Value

Returns a DCLSTATUS value indicating the operation result.

DclFsStatFs

DCLSTATUS DclFsStatFs(
    const char *pszPath,
    DCLFSSTATFS *pStatFs)
Retrieve information about a file system.

Parameters

pszPath - A path on the target file system.
pStatFs - A buffer to receive the StatFs information.

Return Value

Returns a DCLSTATUS value indicating the operation result.
